## CAPM and Cost of Equity for Aurora Technologies

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.03, sd = 0.005)
beta <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.4, sd = 0.1)
rm <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.09, sd = 0.01)
```

Aurora Technologies’ equity beta is **`r round(beta,2)`**. The risk-free rate is **`r round(rf*100,2)`**% and the expected market return is **`r round(rm*100,2)`**%.  

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display:flex;flex-direction:row;gap:6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q11a"><strong>1. What is the expected cost of equity (in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q11a" name="module4_num_q11a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width:150px;"
    data-correct-answer=`r round((rf + beta*(rm-rf))*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01"/>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q11a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ According to CAPM: rₑ = r_f + β (r_m − r_f) = **`r round((rf + beta*(rm-rf))*100,2)`**%.
</div>

:::
